content.raw:
I think it would be more clear to me if the folder structure was like the following:

~~~
tpesim-plugin/
tpesim-plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpesim-plugin/include/ignition/physics/tpesim-features/World.hh
tpesim-plugin/src/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/src/*
~~~

I know this differs from the folder structure of dartsim, but it seems more clear to me. I'm not sure if we would be able to restructure the dartsim folder in a similar way without changing cmake component / target names.

cc @{557058:67759e29-d1df-465f-868d-047738e36fc9}

content.raw:
I think there may have been some confusion about the motivation of the `dartsim/include` directory. The only reason it was created was to illustrate how it’s possible for physics engines to extend the physics plugin features beyond the feature set that’s explicitly declared upstream in `ignition-physics`. There’s actually no need at all for it to exist, nor do we need `tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/World.hh` to exist. All the headers and source files for the TPE plugin can just go into a single source directory.

I’m seeing that the TPE was implemented as its own library, and then the plugin was made to be a light wrapper around it. I wasn’t expecting that \(I figured the TPE would be trivial enough to just implement the whole thing inside the plugin itself\), but I think it’s a good approach.

Personally the structure that I’d recommend would be:

```
tpe/CMakeLists.txt # just does add_subdirectory(lib) add_subdirectory(plugin)
tpe/lib/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/lib/src/*
tpe/lib/include/ignition/physics/tpe/*
tpe/plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/plugin/src/*
```

For line \(4\) I’m concerned that `/usr/include/tpe` would be at risk for a name collision, so I’d recommend nesting it inside of `/usr/include/ignition/physics/tpe`.

There’s no need for a `tpe/plugin/include` because I can’t imagine that the TPE would want to offer any features beyond what’s pre-defined in `ignition-physics`.
content.html:
I think there may have been some confusion about the motivation of the dartsim/include directory. The only reason it was created was to illustrate how it’s possible for physics engines to extend the physics plugin features beyond the feature set that’s explicitly declared upstream in ignition-physics. There’s actually no need at all for it to exist, nor do we need tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/World.hh to exist. All the headers and source files for the TPE plugin can just go into a single source directory.

I’m seeing that the TPE was implemented as its own library, and then the plugin was made to be a light wrapper around it. I wasn’t expecting that (I figured the TPE would be trivial enough to just implement the whole thing inside the plugin itself), but I think it’s a good approach.

Personally the structure that I’d recommend would be:

tpe/CMakeLists.txt # just does add_subdirectory(lib) add_subdirectory(plugin)
tpe/lib/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/lib/src/*
tpe/lib/include/ignition/physics/tpe/*
tpe/plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/plugin/src/*

For line (4) I’m concerned that /usr/include/tpe would be at risk for a name collision, so I’d recommend nesting it inside of /usr/include/ignition/physics/tpe.

There’s no need for a tpe/plugin/include because I can’t imagine that the TPE would want to offer any features beyond what’s pre-defined in ignition-physics.

content.raw:
The proposed directory looks good to me.  

One question, the current TPE library is added as a `component` of ign-physics. Is that ok?
content.html:
The proposed directory looks good to me.

One question, the current TPE library is added as a component of ign-physics. Is that ok?

content.raw:
Sure, there’s nothing inherently wrong with having the TPE library be a component of `ign-physics`.

The only reason to avoid that is if we want the TPE to be usable independently of `ign-physics`, in which case we should probably put it into its own repo entirely. But so long as it’s nested within the `ign-physics` repo, I think it’s sensible to just let it be a “component” library.
content.html:
Sure, there’s nothing inherently wrong with having the TPE library be a component of ign-physics.

The only reason to avoid that is if we want the TPE to be usable independently of ign-physics, in which case we should probably put it into its own repo entirely. But so long as it’s nested within the ign-physics repo, I think it’s sensible to just let it be a “component” library.
